intro: Urophyllum umbelliferum, commonly known as the white wood aster, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer and early fall. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Urophyllum umbelliferum typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodlands.
